audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker addressing the audience as "insiders," introducing himself and his teammate. He mentions they will discuss something they are testing called "clips." A second male speaker introduces himself as a product manager on the YouTube Gaming team. The first speaker expresses his excitement to share their work and asks the second speaker to discuss clips.

The clip starts with a male speaker who introduces an issue that led to the development of a new feature. He notes, in a positive tone, that YouTube is home to both live streams and videos on demand, before adding they wanted to address both of these features. He then cheerfully announces the new feature: "clips", and defines it as a way to share part of a video. The tone shifts to another male speaker, also positive, who requests more information.

The clip begins with a male speaker asking "so what exactly is a clip?". Another male speaker then explains that previously, videos could be shared via URL and adding a parameter to set the start time, which was "great and all". He continues explaining that with clips, one can select a certain amount of seconds from the video or the live stream and it generates its own unique clip URL that will loop on the existing watch page. The first male speaker responds with "amazing, that sounds great" and asks for a demo, and the second male speaker replies in the affirmative with "sure".

The audio clip starts with a man speaking in an enthusiastic tone, indicating agreement. Subsequently, the same man provides instructions, explaining a process step-by-step, while maintaining an informative tone. As he's talking, he provides a title to the video.

The audio clip begins with speech, describing how to share a clip, including referencing a "share clip button" and copying a URL to share on social media. The speaker then states that they'll show how clip viewing works.

A male speaker starts by describing the clip viewing interface, mentioning clip title, the fact that the user created the clip themselves, and pointers inside the video that loop endlessly between them, stating "you can see that that just looped." He concludes by summarizing that this is how the clip view page works.

The clip begins with a male speaker explaining how to exit the clip-viewing experience with options like tapping the "X" button, the "watchful video" button, or anywhere outside the area. He proceeds to demonstrate, saying "let's try it out" before tapping the "X" button. After that, he explains that the video resumes playing exactly where it was before. He transitions to showing how to use clips on a live stream. The clip concludes with nondescript music playing.

The audio clip begins with one male speaker excitedly describing a woman named Valkyrie talking about her background and streaming. After the speaker says the clip button is hit, he adds that the button pulls the last fifteen seconds and then elaborates on how to edit around this feature to highlight the segment regarding Valkyrie's story. The male speaker then notes how the clip can be shared and added to social media. He explains that what follows next is what the clip looks like when it is played back while the livestream is live. He describes what listeners can see and what is happening in real-time. Then a separate male speaker says that these are demos of how to make a clip on a vod.

The audio begins with a male speaker explaining how to find the clips you've made, mentioning the watch later button on the left side and a clips tab on mobile devices. He then clicks on the clips tab to demonstrate. A list of clips appears, along with a way to manage them via a three-dot menu with share and delete options. He demonstrates the share option and then clicks through on a clip to watch it again. The speaker concludes by summarizing that it's the clips tab. In the background, there is quiet background noise.

Two male speakers are engaged in a conversation, the first speaker sounds more enthusiastic, the second is more matter-of-fact, with the first summarizing the capabilities and benefits of a video clipping feature, saying "clips lets your viewers take five to 60 seconds of your videos," sharing them and emphasizing the usefulness of the feature for live streaming creators. Then, the second speaker agrees, highlighting that they'll test the feature with a small group of creators and inviting viewers to try the feature with outtakes at the end of the video, requesting feedback on "ease of use, layout, design," and other general considerations.

The clip opens with a male speaker announcing that listeners will "love Clips." He encourages engagement and ends with "keep it real" in a positive tone. Next, a sound suggestive of speech starts but is incoherent before a second male speaker introduces "insider news time." This is followed by more incoherent sound effects akin to speech. Finally, the speaker announces "page on mobile" in a neutral tone.  He then asks why he's wearing earbuds.

The clip starts with a male speaker mentioning that "users often think of their videos when", before being interrupted by a vulgar exclamation and sounds of retching. A second male speaker then says "He must be talking about..." followed by another vulgar utterance. The first speaker asks for a pause before the clip abruptly ends.

The audio clip begins with one male speaker demanding someone "cut a bunch of this shit out" in an assertive tone. This is followed by a second male speaker, who, in a conversational tone, announces the interview will start over. The first male speaker then laughs. The second speaker replies with "Roger," then someone makes unintelligible sounds. Finally, the second speaker, still sounding conversational, says that "your signal is coming in five by five," and then initiates the interview. The first male speaker, appearing to play along, replies with "five by five, baby." The second speaker then responds by saying "five by five, I don't even know what that means but good, let's do it." Someone follows by saying "it means crystal clear."

The audio clip starts with a male speaker talking about place names, including "Japan" and "Korea". He expresses uncertainty about a place name "IE" and eventually guesses it's Ireland. He then announces, "It's Friday". A short musical tune plays. A male speaker yells "Hey guys, can you keep it down?". A final comment suggests the presence of children.
